intro: Eleocharis angustirostris, commonly known as the narrow-beaked sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and pond margins. The plant has slender, grass-like stems and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinct, pointed tip. Eleocharis angustirostris plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
